channel.title: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]
channel.description:
I'm using Delta.
I changed UID in signlink.java client side. I changed UID in client.java server side with the same UID in signlink.
Now, I try to connect with my client on my server and it doesn't let me connect.
Please, can someone tell me how to fix this please ?
Thanks.

item.title: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

Well, the server says the UID but it doesn’t work.

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]

item.title: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Change the uid client side to what the server says it should be.There uid is bit shifted and uses the client encyption most likely

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]

item.title: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

Well I don’t think so. The UID server side code is like:
expectedUID = *****;

***** is my UID (hidden).

I really need to know it. I tried so many things.

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]

item.title: [HELP] Enforcing my Client to Connect to my Server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Mayby the UID in the server, is actually a UID to block? I know I just used a custom client revision number to block other clients. Worked like a charm.

Read full topic
